learningAssessment.title: Quiz: Benefits of structured content
learningAssessment.shortdesc: This set of questions checks your understanding.

lcMultipleSelect.title: Advantages of XML
lcMultipleSelect.lcQuestion: Which one of the following is/are typical benefits derived from using XML? (You may choose more than one.)

lcAnswerOption.lcAnswerContent: XML provides a framework for structuring content when structuring content is desired.
XML provides strict tag name names, like HTML, so thought doesn't need to be spent creating tag names.
lcAnswerOption.lcFeedback: No, the naming of tags is necessary, and one of the benefits.

lcAnswerOption.lcAnswerContent: XML provides authors with a completely unstructured and unencumbered writing environment.
lcAnswerOption.lcFeedback: No, XML is used to implement structure and writing guidance.

lcSequencing.title: Order of learning object components
lcSequencing.lcQuestion: As presented in this lesson, order the following components of a learning object, in the sequence best presented to a student.

lcSequenceOption.lcAnswerContent: Introduction or overview of the learning content
Statement of the learning objective and the criteria for achieving it
Remediation/review of learning based on assessment results.
